message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the nervous system and how sensations are transmitted through organisms. Options (A), (B), and (D) are all non-living objects or plants that do not have nervous systems and therefore cannot conduct electrical impulses for sensations.

Rocks and trees do not have nervous systems, so they would not have any electrical conductor for sending sensations. Ice is an inanimate object and does not have any biological systems, including a nervous system.
